comment: Dr. Yunek is such a great person, he is so funny and likes memes and writes smiley faces and sad faces on your graded work. He teaches very fast but leaves 10-20 mins after the lecture to help around the class 1 on 1. It was perfect with someone with my ADHD brain who cant focus in long boring lectures and needs hands on work.

Good professor if you've already take music theory, otherwise, stay away!  He assumes students already know music theory and doesn't help those who don't. Difficult timed tests/quizzes!  If you can't work fast, you fail.  For those who are new to the subject, this is very challenging since the topic is quite technical for someone with no exposure.

Dr.Yuneks method of teaching if your not ready to move things quick then I won't advise to take him,I struggled with theory and I didn't feel comfortable due to the fact that everyone else around me knows the material and I feel bad for asking questions while everyone else knew however the textbook is clear ifyougetbehind,however get ready for HW.

I appreciated Jeffrey Yunek as my Music Theory I professor. His lectures were pretty easy to follow even though the concepts weren't always easy. He sets aside 10-ish minutes at the end of every class for group worksheets to make sure you understood what was going on during the lecture.

Dr. Yunek is one of the best professors in the school of music. I had him for Theory 1 and 2, and he makes everything easy to understand and clear! He likes to joke around in class and is really accommodating. There's a lot of homework, but it isn't too difficult and is graded justly. He sets his students up for success and truly cares about them.

Dr. Yunek is genuinely one of the best teachers that I've had at KSU. He's very kind and caring, and he's very funny and easy to get along with. He's incredibly helpful and knows what he's talking about. He also provides good help and info with scheduling and registration. Homework is graded fairly, as well as the tests and quizzes.

He's an okay professor but something that I do not enjoy that he lives by is "group work". At the last 10-15 minutes of each class, he makes us partner up and works on an assignment together. I feel like this isn't the best use of class time and he could be using that time to dive further into lessons.

Lectures are great, homework (prep HW for completion and Graded HW) are all fair in difficulty and graded fairly. Tests are basically a replica of the practice tests. If you have questions just ask him and he will help you. Composition assignments can seem scary but it's not too bad. Review your chords.

Goofy man. LOTS of homework. Majority graded on completion, the rest is fully graded (but it is curved sometimes). Tests are straight forward. If you study, you do well, if you don't... you don't do well. Composition assignment at end of semester is scary, but I got an A. Strict on grading, but prepares you for music theory.
Amazing Theory professor! Makes you actually enjoy theory.

I love Dr. Yunek. You can tell that he loves playing and teaching. He'll give out 1-2 HW assignments per week, but it's for your benefit. He goes by fast, but makes sure to answer questions in case you're lost. He will also call you out to participate, so make sure to pay attention. As long as you pay attention, study, and do HW, you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Yunek was an amazing theory teacher. I had him for both 1 and 2 and I just love his teaching style. He goes very into depth in each music theory concept and he is always willing to give you extra help if you need it. I highly recommend taking him!!!

Dr. Yunek is wonderful! I didn't use my book much, but I had taken AP Theory, so you might want to buy it, seeing as it lasts you 4 semesters. He wants you to pass, but he isn't going to hand it to you. If you struggle, do the homework and show him you are trying. You must show up to class, attendance is taken every day.

By far the best professor at KSU! He is engaging, energetic and just a cool guy in general. You definitely need the textbook/workbook and be prepared to have at least 1-2 hws/week. His test are challenging, but not unrealistically hard. As long as you show up, do ALL the hw, and read the textbook, you should be fine! (He wants you to pass too!)
Great dude. I wish he had tenure.

Class is easy, he puts all the quizzes online. 3 tests and 1 group project towards end of semester. Only hassle is that you're required to attend 3 concerts, 1 of them requires you to drive out to Atlanta. Otherwise hes a witty and passionate guy.

Dr. Yunek was a great teacher who was extremely passionate about what he had taught. He is very genuine and wants you to succeed. There is not much work required for this class just small online quizzes, two major tests and a group presentation towards the end. Great teacher and highly recommended.
He genuinely cares about music and wants you to learn. His tests are super easy as long as you study a little bit. Be sure to take him for music! :)

Dr. Yunek is very knowledgable and genuinely cares about every student passing his class. He is willing to help everyone understand the material and is an overall nice man. I recommend him for Theory and Aural Skills.
